messages: Click on any Workbook below to download, view and edit it.

sections.title: Openings
sections.description: Workbooks examining theory and practice of various Openings.

books.title: The London System
books.description: A comprehensive overview of the omnipresent London System.

subSections.title: White repertoire
subSections.description: Openings analyzed from the White player's point of view

books.title: Budapest Gambit
books.description: A couple of options to safely counter the Budapest Gambit.

books.title: King's Indian - Karpov Variation
books.description: A very popular and effective variation against King's Indian at all levels.
books.file: Openings/White/King's Indian - Karpov variation for White.pgn

subSections.title: Black repertoire
subSections.description: Openings analyzed from the Black player's point of view

books.title: Exchange French
books.description: Breaking symmetry when facing the Exchange Variation in the French.

books.title: Stafford Gambit Traps
books.description: Eric Rosen's entertaining treatise on the Stafford Gambit.  Adapted from Eric's lichess study.

books.title: Ragozin Defense
books.description: A solid addition to one's repertoire against 1.d4

books.title: Endgames by NoseKnowsAll
books.description: Great selection of endgames adapted from a lichess study by @NodeKnowsAll

books.title: Checkmate Patterns
books.description: Basic checkmate patterns named and illustrated.

sections.title: Book Samples
sections.description: Book fragments adapted for Chess Forge

books.title: Chess Strategy Explained
books.description: A small sample of a book by GM Bartek Macieja and IM Witalis Sapis.

books.title: The Complete Chess Swindler
books.description: A small example from an extraordinary book by GM. David Smerdon.
